resource.name: ConSurf
resource.description: The ConSurf server for the identification of functional regions in proteins

function.functionDescription: The ConSurf server is a bioinformatics tool for estimating the evolutionary conservation of amino/nucleic acid positions in a protein/DNA/RNA molecule based on the phylogenetic relations between homologous sequences. The degree to which an amino (or nucleic) acid position is evolutionarily conserved is strongly dependent on its structural and functional importance; rapidly evolving positions are variable while slowly evolving positions are conserved. Thus, conservation analysis of positions among members from the same family can often reveal the importance of each position for the protein (or nucleic acid)'s structure or function. In ConSurf, the evolutionary rate is estimated based on the evolutionary relatedness between the protein (DNA/RNA) and its homologues and considering the similarity between amino (nucleic) acids as re?ected in the substitutions matrix. One of the advantages of ConSurf in comparison to other methods is the accurate computation of the evolutionary rate by usin

resource.name: ConSurf-DB
resource.description: ConSurf-DB provides evolutionary conservation profiles for proteins of known structure in the PDB

function.functionDescription: ConSurf-DB provides evolutionary conservation profiles for proteins of known structure in the PDB. Amino acid sequences similar to each sequence in the PDB were collected and multiply aligned using CSI-BLAST and MAFFT, respectively. The evolutionary conservation of each amino acid position in the alignment was calculated using the Rate4Site algorithm, implemented in the ConSurf web-server. The algorithm takes explicitly into account the phylogenetic relations between the aligned proteins and the stochastic nature of the evolutionary process. Rate4Site assigns a conservation level for each residue using an empirical Bayesian inference. Visual inspection of the conservation patterns on the 3-dimensional structure often enables the identification of key residues that comprise the functionally-important regions of the protein. ConSurf-DB differs from ConSurf in that ConSurf-DB provides pre-calculated conservation profiles, while ConSurf enables considerable flexibility in setting the para

resource.name: ProMaya

function.functionDescription: Pro-Maya (Protein Mutant stAbilitY Anlyzer) predicts the protein stability free energy difference (?G), arising from a single-site amino acid substitution compared to the wild-type, denoted as ??G. The algorithm introduces a novel approach for the prediction of protein stability using available data on mutations made in the same and other positions. Pro-Maya's algorithm combines a newly developed collaborative-filtering-based algorithm (CF), Random Forests regression and a diverse set of descriptors.Our algorithm was extensively benchmarked using cross-validation on two previously utilized datasets of single amino acid mutations and a validation set. The results manifest that using known ??G values for mutations at the query position improves the ??G prediction of other mutations in the position. Our predictions in such cases surpass similar methods significantly, achieving a Pearson correlation coefficient of 0.79, and a root mean square error of 0.96 on the validation set. Because o

resource.name: BALBES
resource.description: BALBES is a system for solving protein structures using x-ray crystallographic data.

function.functionDescription: BALBES is a system for solving protein structures using x-ray crystallographic data. Molecular Replacement(MR) is its core scientific method. BALBES aims to integrate all components, necessary for finding a solution structure by MR, into one system. It consists of a database, scientific programs and a python pipeline. The system is automated so that it needs no user's intervention when running complicated combination of jobs such as model searching, molecular replacement and refinement.

resource.name: ANGSD

resource.name: isoScale
resource.description: isoScale is a proteomics software to quantify peptides based on the total ion intensity of the MS/MS spectra. The software provides also relative quantification of isobaric peptides co-fragmented in MS/MS spectra which share the same sequence but have distinct localizations of post-translational modifications (PTMs). The principle of the quantification is described in Pesavento et al. (Analytical Chemistry, 2006). We recommend the use of the software for middle-down or top-down analyses, as it is suitable for direct comparison of single sequences with scrambled combinatorial PTMs. The user interface provides a choice for CID/HCD or ETD fragmentation. It is suitable for high and low resolution data, as it allows the choice of MS/MS ion tolerance for searching the fragment ions required to calculate the fragment ion relative ratio of isobaric peptides (FIRR).

function.functionDescription: Quantification of post-translationally modified peptides, mainly histone peptides

input.dataDescription: Mascot output file

resource.name: Histone Coder
resource.description: Histone Coder counts the number of MS/MS ions in a given spectrum to determine the unambiguous localization of a post-translational modification (PTM). The software lists number and type of site determining ions found between the assigned PTM localization by Mascot (Matrix Science) and the closest other amino acids which can host the modification. The PTMs included in the script are phosphorylation (S,T,Y), acetylation (K), mono- and dimethylation (K,R) and trimethylation (K). From the interface it is possible to select filters for spectrum score, fragment ion types and MS/MS tolerance for the search. As additional feature, Histone Coder converts the Mascot output to the standard Brno nomenclature for PTMs (e.g. K4me3K14ac).

function.functionDescription: Localization of PTMs on histone proteins

resource.description: Divide-and-Conquer Multiple Sequence Alignment ( DCA) is a program for producing fast, high quality simultaneous multiple sequence alignments of amino acid, RNA, or DNA sequences. The program is based on the DCA algorithm, a heuristic approach to sum-of-pairs (SP) optimal alignment that has been developed at the FSPM over the years 1995-97.

resource.name: Dialign
resource.description: While standard alignment methods rely on comparing single residues and imposing gap penalties, DIALIGN constructs pairwise and multiple alignments by comparing entire segments of the sequences. No gap penalty is used. This approach can be used for both global and local alignment, but it is particularly successful in situations where sequences share only local homologies.

function.functionDescription: multiple amino acid alignment

resource.name: Pariga
resource.description: PARIGA enables users to perform all-against-all BLAST searches on two sets of sequences selected by the user. It stores the two BLAST output in a python-serialized-objects database, results can be filtered according to several parameters in real-time fashion, without re-running the process and avoiding additional programming efforts. Results can be interrogated by the user using logical operations, for example to retrieve cases where two queries match same targets, or when sequences from the two datasets are reciprocal best hits, or when a query matches a target in multiple regions.

resource.name: Bgee
resource.description: Bgee is a database to retrieve and compare gene expression patterns between animal species. Bgee first maps heterogeneous expression data (currently EST, Affymetrix, and in situ hybridization data) on anatomical and developmental ontologies. Then, in order to perform automated cross species comparisons, homology relationships across anatomical ontologies, and comparison criteria between developmental ontologies, are designed.

resource.name: Selectome
resource.description: Database of positive selection based on a rigorous branch-site specific likelihood test

resource.name: PIntron
resource.description: PIntron is a pipeline for gene-structure prediction based on spliced alignment of transcript sequences (ESTs and mRNAs) against a genomic sequence.
resource.license: GNU Affero General Public License v3

resource.name: Cppp
resource.description: Cppp computes a Persistent Phylogeny from a binary character matrix. In a Persistent Phylogeny each character can back mutate at most once.

resource.name: LightStringGraph
resource.description: LightStringGraphs (LSG) is an external memory string graph construction tool

resource.name: ASAP
resource.description: A framework for promoter analysis based on a fast search engine using enhanced suffix arrays. The framework includes several statistics for calculating over-representation of motifs in a set of promoters from co-regulated genes compared to a background set.

resource.name: BARNACLE
resource.description: BARNACLE is a Python library for RNA 3D structure prediction. It can be used for probabilistic sampling of RNA structures that are compatible with a given nucleotide sequence and that are RNA like on a local length scale.

resource.name: BASILISK
resource.description: BASILISK is a probabilistic model of the conformational space of amino acid side chains in proteins. Unlike rotamer libraries, BASILISK models the chi angles in continuous space, including the influence of the protein's backbone.
resource.tag: continuous model of side chain conformational space

resource.name: BayesMD
resource.description: BayesMD is a flexible, fully Bayesian model for motif discovery consisting of motif, background and alignment modules. BayesMD can be customized to different kind of biological applications, e.g. microarray, ChIP-chip, ditag, CAGE data analysis by integrating appropriately chosen features and functionalities.
resource.tag: recognition of genes and regulatory elements

resource.name: EasyGene
resource.description: EasyGene is a fully automated gene prediction for prokaryotes. EasyGene produces a list of predicted genes for a chosen prokaryotic genome.

resource.name: GMD
resource.description: GMD is a package for non-parametric distance measurement between two discrete frequency distributions.

resource.name: MASTR
resource.description: MASTR performs multiple alignment and secondary structure prediction on a set of structural RNA sequences.

resource.name: miRMaid
resource.description: miRMaid is an intuitive and modular software platform designed to unify miRBase and independent miRNA data resources. It enables miRNA researchers to computationally address complex questions involving the multitude of miRNA data resources.
resource.license: GNU Lesser General Public License v2.1

resource.name: MoAn
resource.description: MoAn is a discriminative pattern finder capable of using a very large negative set to greatly improve its predictive power. It is capable of handling sequences that are not repeat masked given that the negative set is a representative sample of promoters from the organism examined.

resource.name: Mocapy plus plus
resource.description: Mocapy++ is a Dynamic Bayesian Network toolkit, implemented in C++. It supports discrete, multinomial, Gaussian, Kent, Von Mises and Poisson nodes. Inference and learning is done by Gibbs sampling/Stochastic-EM.

function.functionDescription: Mocapy++ is a general purpose toolkit, but it contains quite some functionality that is specific to the field of bioinformatics, and in particular structural bioinformatics.

resource.name: Phaistos
resource.description: Phaistos is a framework for all-atom Monte Carlo simulations of proteins. It incorporates several advanced probabilistic models of protein structure for conformational sampling, efficient move-algorithms and the OPLS and PROFASI forcefields

resource.name: Phobius
resource.description: Phobius is a server for prediction of transmembrane topology and signal peptides from the amino acid sequence of a protein.

resource.name: Saqqaq Genome Project
resource.description: The primary data from the saqqaq genome project: the sequencing of an Ancient Human Genome, obtained from a permafrost-preserved hair, about 4,000 years old, of a male palaeo-Eskimo of the Saqqaq culture, the earliest known settlers in Greenland.

resource.name: Antar
resource.description: Companion to the paper "MicroRNA transfection and AGO-bound CLIP-seq datasets reveal distinct determinants of miRNA action" and provides predictions for miRNA targets for human and mouse using the two predictive models described in the paper: a model trained from microarry studies following transfection, and a model trained from PAR-CLIP datasets.

resource.name: BWA-PSSM
resource.description: BWA-PSSM is a probabilistic short read aligner based on the use of position specific scoring matrices (PSSM). Like many of the existing aligners it is fast and sensitive. Unlike most other aligners, however, it also adaptible in the sense that one can direct the alignment based on known biases within the data set. It is coded as a modification of the original BWA alignment program and shares the genome index structure as well as many of the command line options.

resource.name: cWords
resource.description: cWords is a method used for identification of over-represented words in a set of ranked sequences. By default it is aimed at human miRNA analysis; you give a ranked list of differential expression values of genes across two conditions and it finds words in 3' UTRs of lengths 6 and 7 over-represented in the most regulated genes.

resource.name: WAR
resource.description: Webserver for Aligning non-coding RNAs. WAR is an easy-to-use webserver that makes it possible to simultaneously use the best methods for aligning and predicting the consensus secondary structure for a set of non-coding RNA sequences.

resource.name: HyperCLDB
resource.collection: Cell Line Integrated Molecular Authentication database and Identification tool
resource.description: The hypertextual version of the Cell Line Database (CLDB), which is not directly accessible, a collection of information on human and animal cell lines available from some of the main European cell banks and many Italian research laboratories

function.functionDescription: Access to human and animal cell lines data through the index of cell line names
Access to human and animal cell lines data through the index of species and strains of origin
Access to human and animal cell lines data through the index of tissues of origin
Access to human and animal cell lines data through the index of tumors
Access to human and animal cell lines data through the index of pathologies
Access to human and animal cell lines data through the index of transforming agents
Access to human and animal cell lines data through the index of species and strains of origin

resource.name: CLIMA 2
resource.collection: USMI Cell Line Database and Analisys Tools
resource.description: Cell Line Integrated Molecular Authentication database and Identification tool
resource.tag: mysql relational database, PHP, STR profiling of human cell lines, cell line identification, cell line misidentification

function.functionDescription: Human cell line STR profile search by name

input.dataDescription: human and animal cell line name

criteria for search by name. Can be one of: exact (the name of the cell line must match exactly), truncated (the cell line name must start exactly by the query term), soundex (the cell line name must have an identical soundex() value), nopunt (the cell line name must be exactly teh same, after removal of characters "-", ".", " ", "(", ")", and "/".
Optional valid email address of the user. If provided, some results will also be returned by email

output.dataDescription: Table with a list of cell lines matching the queried name with related STR profiles, catalogue code, and CLDB id, when available

function.functionDescription: Human cell line STR profile search by locus

input.dataDescription: The number of repeats in the given locus. E.g., here we refer to the first repeat number related to CSF1PO, but the system is able to manage up to four values for D18S51, D21S11, D8S1179, FGA, TH01, VWA, CSF1PO, D13S317, D3S1358, D16S539, D5S818, D7S820, TPOX, D2S1338, and D19S433, as well as two values for Amelogenin.

The logical operator used for the evaluation of the expression linking two values for the same locus. E.g., here we refer to the logical operator linking CSF1PO_data1 and CSF1PO_data2, but the system is able to manage up to three operators for D18S51, D21S11, D8S1179, FGA, TH01, VWA, CSF1PO, D13S317, D3S1358, D16S539, D5S818, D7S820, TPOX, D2S1338, and D19S433, as well as one for Amelogenin.
Optional valid email address of the user. If provided, some results will also be returned by email

output.dataDescription: Table with a list of cell lines matching the queried locus values with related STR profiles, catalogue code, and CLDB id, when available

function.functionDescription: Cell line identification through STR profie comparison

input.dataDescription: Up to four repeat values for D5S818, D13S317, D7S820, D16S539, VWA, TH01, TPOX, CSF1PO, as well as two values for Amelogenin.
Lower percent match, as described in the ANSI/ATCC-ASN-0002-2011 on "Authentication of Human Cell Lines: Standardization of STR Profiling", to show cell line STR profiles from the database

output.dataDescription: Table with a list of cell lines matching the queried profile with a standard percent match greater than or equal to the input score, with related STR profiles and actual match score.

resource.name: ICLC Interlab Cell Line Collection Catalogue
resource.collection: USMI Cell Line Database and Analisys Tools
resource.description: The on-line catalogue of the Interlab Cell Line Collection of human and animal cell lines

function.functionDescription: Search by name

input.dataDescription: cell line name in free text

This parameter defines the type of search, by specifying whether the retrieved cell line name(s) must be identical to the searched name (value "Exact"), or must begin with the given name ("Truncated"), or must have the same soundex() value ("Soundex")

output.dataDescription: The summary description of retreived cell lines with links to the complete description and to the ICLC web site for order purposes.

function.functionDescription: Free text search

input.dataDescription: Free text terms to be searched in cell lines' descriptions.

output.dataDescription: The summary description of retreived cell lines with links to the complete description and to the ICLC web site for order purposes.

function.functionDescription: Search by properties

input.dataDescription: Optional name of species and strain of origin of the cell line, according to CLDB reference vocabulary
Optional name of tissue / organ of origin of the cell line, according to CLDB reference vocabulary.
Optional name of tumor of origin of the cell line, according to CLDB reference vocabulary
Optional name of pathology of origin of the cell line, according to CLDB reference vocabulary
Optional free text in the description of the cell line

output.dataDescription: The summary description of retreived cell lines with links to the complete description and to the ICLC web site for order purposes.

resource.name: CABRI
resource.description: Common Access to Biological Resources and Information - A collection of European Biological Resource Centre catalogues.

function.functionDescription: SRS Standard Interface search

credits.creditsFunding: Common Access to Biological Resources and Information (CABRI), EU 5th FP (1996-1999)

resource.name: ASPic
resource.description: Aspic predicts the gene structure by aligning ESTs against a genomic region

resource.name: TRONCO
resource.description: Tronco reconstructs the cancer progression from cross-sectional data

resource.name: pfam
resource.description: This service allows you to access and retrieve data from the pfam database. The Pfam database is a large collection of protein domain families. Each family is represented by multiple sequence alignments and hidden Markov models (HMMs).

resource.name: Europe PMC RESTful Web Service for Articles
resource.description: The Europe PMC RESTful Web Service gives you access to all of the publications and related information held in the Europe PMC database.

resource.name: WSCitationImplService
resource.description: This web service gives programmatic access to all of the publications and related information in Europe PubMed Central (Europe PMC).

resource.name: EMBOSS Backtranambig
resource.description: EMBOSS backtranambig reads a protein sequence and writes the nucleic acid sequence it could have come from. It does this by using nucleotide ambiguity codes that represent all possible codons for each amino acid.

resource.name: EMBOSS Backtranseq
resource.description: EMBOSS backtranseq reads a protein sequence and writes the nucleic acid sequence it is most likely to have come from.

resource.name: EMBOSS Sixpack
resource.description: EMBOSS sixpack reads a DNA sequence and outputs the three forward and (optionally) three reverse translations in a visual manner.

resource.name: EMBOSS Transeq
resource.description: EMBOSS transeq translates nucleic acid sequences to their corresponding peptide sequences. It can translate to the three forward and three reverse frames, and output multiple frame translations at once.

resource.name: SAPS
resource.description: SAPS (Statistical Analysis of Protein Sequences) evaluates a wide variety of protein sequence properties using statistics.

resource.name: EMBOSS pepwindow
resource.description: EMBOSS pepwindow draws a hydropathy plot for a protein sequence.

resource.name: EMBOSS pepstats
resource.description: EMBOSS pepstats calculates statistics for a protein such as molecular weight and isoelectric point.

resource.name: EMBOSS isochore
resource.description: EMBOSS isochore plots GC content in windows over a DNA sequence.

resource.name: EMBOSS cpgplot
resource.description: EMBOSS cpgplot identifies CpG islands in nucleotide sequences.
resource.topic: Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs

resource.name: Readseq
resource.description: Readseq reads and converts biosequences between a selection of common biological sequence formats, including EMBL, GenBank and fasta sequence formats.

resource.name: EMBOSS seqret
resource.description: EMBOSS seqret reads and writes (returns) sequences. It is useful for a variety of tasks, including extracting sequences from databases, displaying sequences, reformatting sequences, producing the reverse complement of a sequence, extracting fragments of a sequence, sequence case conversion or any combination of the above functions.

resource.name: MapMi
resource.description: MapMi is a tool for mapping and analysis of miRNA sequences. It is designed to locate miRNA precursor sequences in existing genomic sequences (e.g Ensembl and Ensembl Metazoa), using potential mature miRNA sequences as input. After searching the genome for the provided mature sequences, these hits are extended and classified taking into account major structural properties of known miRNA precursors.

resource.name: Infernal cmscan
resource.description: Infernal cmscan is used to search the CM-format Rfam database.

resource.name: Wise2DBA
resource.description: The Wise2 DNA Block Aligner (DBA) aligns two DNA sequences using the assumption that the sequences share a number of colinear blocks of conservation separated by potentially large and varied lengths of DNA in the two sequences.

resource.name: PromoterWise
resource.description: PromoterWise compares two DNA sequences allowing for inversions and translocations, ideal for promoters.

resource.name: GeneWise
resource.description: GeneWise compares a protein sequence to a genomic DNA sequence, allowing for introns and frameshifting errors.

resource.name: Clustal Omega
resource.description: Clustal Omega is a multiple sequence alignment program for protein sequences.

resource.name: RADAR
resource.description: RADAR identifies gapped approximate repeats and complex repeat architectures involving many different types of repeats.

resource.name: PROSITE Scan
resource.description: PROSITE Scan compares a protein sequence against the signatures in PROSITE

resource.name: Pratt
resource.description: Pratt searches for patterns conserved in sets of unaligned protein sequences.

resource.name: PfamScan
resource.description: PfamScan is used to search a FASTA sequence against a library of Pfam HMM.

resource.name: HMMER hmmscan
resource.description: HMMER hmmscan searches a database of Hidden Markov Model (HMM) protein signatures with a protein sequence.

resource.name: InterProScan 5
resource.description: InterProScan is a tool that combines different protein signature recognition methods into one resource. InterProScan 5 is a reimplementation of the traditional InterProScan 4.x series and adds features such as pathway annotations and signal peptide and transmembrane prediction using Phobius.

resource.name: FingerPRINTScan
resource.description: FingerPRINTScan identifies the closest matching PRINTS sequence motif fingerprints in a protein sequence.

resource.name: WSDbfetch
resource.description: The dbfetch services provide access to entries from various up-to-date biological databases using entry identifiers or accession numbers.

resource.name: CENSOR
resource.description: CENSOR screens sequences against a reference collection of sequence repeats, “censors” (masks) homologous portions with masking symbols and generates a report classifying all found repeats. CENSOR supports repeat finding and masking in both nucleotide and protein sequences.

resource.name: ChebiWebServiceService
resource.description: Chemical Entities of Biological Interest (ChEBI) is a freely available dictionary of molecular entities focused on ‘small’ chemical compounds.

resource.name: QueryService
resource.description: The OLS provides a web service interface to query multiple ontologies from a single location with a unified output format.The OLS can integrate any ontology available in the Open Biomedical Ontology (OBO) format.

resource.name: FUNCRESAnnotationService
resource.description: SAS is a tool for applying structural information to a given protein sequence. It uses FASTA to scan a given protein sequence against all the proteins of known 3D structure in the Protein Data Bank and provides functional residue annotation based on data from the Catalytic Site Atlas and PDBsum.

resource.name: SearchService
resource.description: ENA sequence search is search service against all nucleotide sequences available in the European Nucleotide Archive (ENA), Ensembl and Ensembl Genomes databases.

resource.name: PSICQUIC (ubf-ucl)
resource.description: Search the ubf-ucl database for interations using protein ids

resource.name: PSICQUIC (UniProt)
resource.description: Search the UniProt database for interactions using protein ids

resource.name: PSICQUIC (Reactome)
resource.description: Search Reactome data for interactions using protein ids

resource.name: PSICQUIC (Reactome-FIs)
resource.description: Search Reactome FIs for interactions using protein ids

resource.name: PSICQUIC (MBInfo)
resource.description: Search MBInfo database for interactions using a protein id

resource.name: PSICQUIC (MolCon)
resource.description: Search Molecular Connections data for protein interactions using a protein id

resource.name: PSICQUIC (MPIDB)
resource.description: Search Microbial Protein Interaction database for protein interactions using a protein id

resource.name: PSIQUIC (MINT)
resource.description: Search the MINT database for protein interactions using a protein id

resource.name: PSIQUIC (IntAct)
resource.description: IntAct provides a freely available, open source database system and analysis tools for molecular interaction data.

resource.name: PSICQUIC (InnateDB)
resource.description: InnateDB is a publicly available database of the genes, proteins, experimentally-verified interactions and signaling pathways involved in the innate immune response of humans, mice and bovines to microbial infection.

resource.name: PSICQUIC (I2D)
resource.description: The Interologous Interaction Database (I2D) integrates known, experimental and predicted PPIs for five model organisms and humans. Search the I2D using a protein identifier

resource.name: PSICQUIC (HPIDb)
resource.description: Search the Host - Pathogen Interaction Database using a protein id

resource.name: PSICQUIC (ChEMBL)
resource.description: Search for protein interactions in the ChEMBL database.

resource.name: ChEBI Display Images
resource.description: This REST service allows you to serve up ChEBI structures directly to your content using a few parameters in your URL.

resource.name: European Nucleotide Archive (ENA) Browser
resource.description: The European Nucleotide Archive (ENA) Browser provides functionality to view and retrieve nucleotide sequence data archived and exchanged by the International Sequence Database Collaboration (INSDC).

resource.name: FASTA (REST)
resource.description: FASTA stands for FAST-All, reflecting the fact that it can be used for a fast protein comparison or a fast nucleotide comparison.

resource.name: The BioCatalogue REST API
resource.description: The BioCatalogue is a registry of Web Services for the Life Sciences, with a REST API that allows you to browse, search, filter and view details of the services in the registry, together with all the metadata and monitoring information about these service

resource.name: WSDBFetchServerService
resource.description: WSDbfetch: entry retrieval using entry identifiers or accession numbers for various biological databases, including EMBL-Bank, InterPro, MEDLINE, Patent Proteins, PDB, RefSeq, UniParc, UniProtKB and UniRef.

resource.name: ChEMBL RESTful Web Service
resource.description: The ChEMBL REST web service API provides the functionality to support programmatic retrieval of ChEMBLdb compound, target, assay, and bioactivity data.

resource.name: ClustalW2 Phylogeny (REST)
resource.description: Create Neighbor-joining or UPGMA phylogentic trees from a multiple sequence alignment using ClustalW.

resource.name: Phobius (REST)
resource.description: Transmembrane topology and signal peptides prediction from the amino acid sequence of a protein using Phobius.

resource.name: T-Coffee (REST)
resource.description: T-Coffee is a multiple sequence alignment program. The main characteristic of T-Coffee is that it will allow you to combine results obtained with several alignment methods.

resource.name: MView (REST)
resource.description: MView re-formats the results of a sequence database search (BLAST, FASTA, etc) or a multiple alignment (MSF, PIR, CLUSTAL, etc) adding optional HTML markup to control colouring and web page layout.

resource.name: MUSCLE (REST)
resource.description: MUSCLE (MUltiple Sequence Comparison by Log-Expectation) multiple sequence alignment tool.

resource.name: MAFFT (REST)
resource.description: MAFFT (Multiple Alignment using Fast Fourier Transform) is a high speed multiple sequence alignment program.

resource.name: Kalign (REST)
resource.description: Kalign is a fast and accurate multiple sequence alignment algorithm for DNA and protein sequences.

resource.name: DbClustal (REST)
resource.description: ClustalW 2 is a general purpose multiple sequence alignment program for DNA or proteins. It produces biologically meaningful multiple sequence alignments of divergent sequences.

resource.name: ClustalW2 (REST)
resource.description: ClustalW 2 is a general purpose multiple sequence alignment program for DNA or proteins. It produces biologically meaningful multiple sequence alignments of divergent sequences.

resource.name: WU-BLAST (REST)
resource.description: WU-BLAST stands for Washington University Basic Local Alignment Search Tool. The emphasis of this tool is to find regions of sequence similarity or homology quickly, with minimum loss of sensitivity.

resource.name: PSI-Search (REST)
resource.description: Similar to PSI-BLAST, PSI-Search uses SSEARCH to perform a rigorous Smith & Waterman search of a protein database.

resource.name: PSI-BLAST (REST)
resource.description: Position Specific Iterative BLAST (PSI-BLAST) refers to a feature of NCBI BLAST 2.0 in which a position-specific scoring matrix (PSSM) profile is constructed from set of BLAST alignments.

resource.name: NCBI BLAST (REST)
resource.description: NCBI BLAST is a sequence similarity search program.

resource.name: lalign (REST)
resource.description: Local pairwise sequence alignment of DNA or protein sequences using lalign, part of the FASTA suite.

resource.name: EMBOSS water (REST)
resource.description: Pairwise sequence alignment of DNA or protein sequences using Smith-Waterman local alignment.

resource.name: EMBOSS stretcher (REST)
resource.description: Pairwise sequence alignment of DNA or protein sequences using Myers and Miller global alignment.

resource.name: EMBOSS needle (REST)
resource.description: Pairwise sequence alignment of DNA or protein sequences using Needleman-Wunsch global alignment.

resource.name: EMBOSS matcher (REST)
resource.description: Pairwise sequence alignment of DNA or protein sequences using Waterman-Eggert local alignment.

resource.name: PRANK (REST)
resource.description: PRANK is a probabilistic multiple alignment program for DNA, codon and amino-acid sequences. It’s based on a novel algorithm that treats insertions correctly and avoids over-estimation of the number of deletion events. In addition, PRANK borrows ideas from maximum likelihood methods used in phylogenetics and correctly takes into account the evolutionary distances between sequences. Lastly, PRANK allows for defining a potential structure for sequences to be aligned and then, simultaneously with the alignment, predicts the locations of structural units in the sequences.

resource.name: FASTM (REST)
resource.description: The FASTA (pronounced FAST-Aye) suite of programs includes three specialist programs for searching databases with a set of sequence fragments, as may be obtained from protein mass spec. or Edman protein sequencing:FASTF - Compares an ordered peptide mixture, as would be obtained by Edman degradation of a CNBr cleavage of a protein, against a protein database.FASTM - Compares an ordered set of peptides to a protein sequence database or an ordered set of oligonucleotides to a nucleotide sequence database.FASTS - Compares a set of short peptide fragments, as would be obtained from mass-spec. analysis of a protein, against a protein database

resource.name: MIRIAM Resources
resource.description: REST services for MIRIAM Resources. Allows you to: retrieve the list of all available MIRIAM datatypes; retrieve information about a given datatype; resolve a given MIRIAM URN.

resource.name: WSDBFetchDoclitServerService
resource.description: WSDbfetch: entry retrieval using entry identifiers or accession numbers for various biological databases, including EMBL-Bank, InterPro, MEDLINE, Patent Proteins, PDB, RefSeq, UniParc, UniProtKB and UniRef.

resource.name: JDispatcherService
resource.description: T-Coffee is a multiple sequence alignment program. Multiple sequence alignment programs are meant to align a set of sequences previously gathered using other programs such as BLAST or FASTA.

resource.name: picr
resource.description: Map accession numbers between databases. It will also retrieve the UPI(UniProt Archive (UniParc) identifier of the given accession number.

resource.name: MiriamProviderService
resource.description: MIRIAM ( (Minimal Information Requested In the Annotation of Models) Web Services provide generation and resolving facilities for MIRIAM Annotations.

resource.name: WSDBFetchServerLegacyService
resource.description: The services retrieves entries (sequences, litterature abstract, protein structure information, etc) from various up-to-date biological databases using databases entry identifiers or accession numbers.

resource.name: SBOProviderService
resource.description: The Systems Biology Ontology project (SBO) goal is to develop controlled vocabularies and ontologies tailored specifically for the kinds of problems being faced in Systems Biology, especially in the context of computational modeling.

resource.name: whatizit
resource.description: Whatizit is a text processing system that allows you to do textmining tasks on text. It identifyies molecular biology terms and links them to publicly available databases.

resource.name: ChEMBL PSICQUIC Service
resource.description: PSICQUIC is an effort from the HUPO Proteomics Standard Initiative (HUPO-PSI) to standardise the access to molecular interaction databases programmatically.This specific implementation provides remote access to the ChEMBL database, at the EBI.

resource.name: IntAct PSICQUIC Service
resource.description: PSICQUIC is an effort from the HUPO Proteomics Standard Initiative (HUPO-PSI) to standardise the access to molecular interaction databases programmatically.This specific implementation provides remote access to the IntAct database, at the EBI.

resource.name: EB-eye
resource.description: Search globally across all EMBL-EBI databases.

resource.name: EBISearchService
resource.description: High-performance, full-featured text searches across all EMBL-EBI databases or in selected databases available from EMBL-EBI.

resource.name: dbfetch
resource.description: Dbfetch provides an easy way to retrieve entries from various databases available at EMBL-EBI in a consistent manner.

resource.name: graphtools
resource.description: Designed for the detection of regulatory signals in non-coding sequences.

resource.name: WormBase
resource.description: WormBase contains data on multiple species of nematode including Caenorhabditis elegans.

resource.name: Application
resource.description: PROLIFIC (protein-literature investigation for interacting compounds) provides a one-step solution to investigate available information on given protein names, sequences, similar proteins or sequences on the gene level.

resource.name: PathJam
resource.description: PathJam integrates pathway-related annotations from several public sources (Reactome, KEGG, Biocarta, etc) making easier the understanding of gene lists of interest.

resource.name: PANTHER Classification System
resource.description: Protein Analysis THrough Evolutionary Relationships (PANTHER) is a comprehensive software system for inferring the functions of genes based on their evolutionary relationships.

resource.name: ncRNAwsdl
resource.description: NONCODE database integrates expression and functional long noncoding RNAs (lncRNA) data.

resource.name: NomenclatureService
resource.description: MIRU-VNTRplus allows users to analyse genotyping data of their strains alone or in comparison with a reference database of strains representing the major Mycobacterium tuberculosis lineages

resource.name: AphiaNameService
resource.description: Search the WoRMS taxonomy

resource.name: FlyMine
resource.description: An integrated database for Drosophila and Anopheles genomics

resource.name: PESINameService
resource.description: As a user or developer you can use the PESI webservice to feed your own application with standard PESI taxonomy.

resource.name: ma
resource.description: eMouseAtlas is a comprehensive online resource to visualise mouse development and investigate gene expression in the mouse embryo.

resource.name: CRAVAT
resource.description: Cancer-Related Analysis of Variants Toolkit (CRAVAT) is designed to facilitate the high-throughput assessment and prioritization of genes and missense alterations important for cancer tumorigenesis.

resource.name: RegistryWS
resource.description: JABAWS stands for JAva Bioinformatics Analysis Web Services. It is a collection of web services for bioinformatics, and currently provides services that make it easy to access well-known multiple sequence alignment and protein disorder prediction programs from Jalview.

resource.name: ClustalOWS
resource.description: JABAWS stands for JAva Bioinformatics Analysis Web Services. It is a collection of web services for bioinformatics, and currently provides services that make it easy to access well-known multiple sequence alignment and protein disorder prediction programs from Jalview.

resource.name: MSAprobsWS
resource.description: MSAProbs is a multiple alignment algorithm for protein sequences.

resource.name: GLprobsWS
resource.description: GLProbs is a simple and effective approach to improve the accuracy of multiple sequence alignment.

resource.name: AAConWS
resource.description: AACon is a set of tools implementing different conservation scores.

resource.name: JronnWS
resource.description: RONN predict whether a protein is disordered, given its amino acid sequence.

resource.name: DisemblWS
resource.description: DisEMBL is a computational tool for prediction of disordered/unstructured regions within a protein sequence.

resource.name: GlobPlotWS
resource.description: GlobPlot allows the user to plot the tendency within the query protein for order/globularity and disorder.

resource.name: IUPredWS
resource.description: IUPred recognizes unstructured/disordered regions from the amino acid sequence based on the estimated pairwise energy content.

resource.name: JpredWS
resource.description: The Jnet algorithm provides a three-state (α-helix, β-strand and coil) prediction of secondary structure. Given either a single protein sequence or a multiple sequence alignment, Jpred derives alignment profiles from which predictions of secondary structure and solvent accessibility are made.

resource.name: RNAalifoldWS
resource.description: RNAalifold predicts a consensus secondary structure of a set of aligned sequences.

resource.name: TcoffeeWS
resource.description: T-Coffee is a multiple sequence alignment package that can be used for DNA, RNA and protein sequences. It can be used to align sequences or to combine the output of other alignment methods (Clustal, Mafft, Probcons, Muscle…) into one unique alignment

resource.name: MafftWS
resource.description: MAFFT is a multiple sequence alignment program

resource.name: ProbconsWS
resource.description: ProbCons is a tool for progressive protein multiple sequence alignment based on probabilistic consistency.

resource.name: MuscleWS
resource.description: MUSCLE (MUltiple Sequence Comparison by Log- Expectation) is a multiple sequence algnment tool.

resource.name: ClustalWS
resource.description: ClustalW finds the best global alignment for a set of input sequences (nucleic acid or protein)

resource.name: bioLabeler
resource.description: BioLabeler extracts UMLS concepts from Biomedical texts such as scientific paper abstracts, experiments descriptions or medical notes and can be use to automatically curate and annotate BioMedical Literature

resource.name: SimapWS
resource.description: SIMAP is a database containing the similarity space formed by about all amino-acid sequences from public databases and completely sequenced genomes.

resource.name: SimapService
resource.description: SIMAP is a database containing the similarity space formed by about all amino-acid sequences from public databases and completely sequenced genomes.

resource.name: iHOP_SOAP-document-literal
resource.description: The iHOP (Information Hyperlinked over Proteins) resource uses text-mining methods to identify information on specific genes and proteins, their physical interactions and regulatory relationships, their relevance in pathologies, and their interactions with chemical compounds. iHOP parses thousands of PubMed documents every day and collects information specific to thousands of different biological molecules.

resource.name: CellBase
resource.description: CellBase implements a set of RESTful web services that query a centralized database containing: (i) core features such as genes, transcripts and exons or proteins; (ii) regulatory elements; (iii) functional ontologies; (iv) variation data and (v) systems biology information such as pathways or protein interactome.

resource.name: WikiPathways
resource.description: Web service to WikiPathways, a wiki for biological pathways.

resource.name: BioCyc
resource.description: BioCyc is a large collection of Pathway/Genome Databases (PGDBs), with tools for understanding their data.

resource.name: MFSearcher
resource.description: Kazusa Molecular Formula Searcher (MFSearcher) is a RESTful web service for high-throughput prediction of elemental compositions from accurate mass values detected by high-resolution mass spectrometers.

resource.name: FunctionalServiceService
resource.description: GWASrap systematically supports genetic variant representation, annotation and prioritization for data generated from GWAS and NGS

resource.name: RegionServiceService
resource.description: GWASdb is a one stop shop which combines collections of GVs from GWAS and their comprehensive functional annotations, as well as disease classifications.

resource.name: Scooby_Domain_Prediction
resource.description: Scooby-domain (Sequence hydrophobicity predicts domains) is a method to identify globular regions in protein sequence that are suitable for structural studies

resource.name: DOMAINATION_Domain_Prediction
resource.description: DOMAINATION is a method to identify domains in a protein sequence from similarity searches using PSI-BLAST. The identified domains are used in individual PSI-BLAST searches to improve detection of distant homologous sequences. DOMAINATION iterates until no new domains are found.

resource.name: TFmodellerServiceService
resource.description: The TFmodeller program scans a protein sequence P against a library of protein-DNA complexes and builds comparative models of P if good templates are found.

resource.name: ModelProcessorService
resource.description: Model processor web service provides operations for converting files from SBML to CopasiML format and vice versa, and also to validate files in either of these formats.

resource.name: PromoSerSOAP
resource.description: Human, Mouse and Rat promoter extraction service

resource.name: uniprot
resource.description: UniProt provides a comprehensive, high-quality and freely accessible resource of protein sequence and functional information.

resource.name: TYNAService
resource.description: TopNet-like Yale Network Analyzer (tYNA) is a Web system for managing, comparing and mining multiple networks, both directed and undirected.

resource.name: Taxonomic Name Resolution Service
resource.description: The TNRS, or Taxonomic Name Resolution Service, is an online application for automated and user-supervised standardization of plant scientific names.

resource.name: FetchProDomService
resource.description: Retrieve information from ProDom, a comprehensive set of protein domain families automatically generated from the UniProt Knowledge Database

resource.name: termine

resource.name: Key Pathway Miner
resource.description: We introduce the latest version of the Key-PathwayMiner software framework. Given a biological network and a set of case- control studies, KeyPathwayMiner efficiently extracts all maximal connected sub-networks. These sub-networks contain the genes that are mainly dysregulated, e.g., differentially expressed, in most cases studied. The exact quantities for “mainly” and “most” are modeled with two easy-to-interpret parameters (K, L) that allows the user to control the number of outliers (not dysregulated genes/cases) in the solutions. We developed two slightly varying models (INES and GLONE) that fall into the class of NP-Hard optimization problems. To tackle the combinatorial explosion of the search space, we designed a set of exact and heuristic algorithms.

resource.name: IMSDB
resource.description: IMSDB is a comprehensive database application and analysis platform that is capable of combining metabolic data, like IMS chromatograms, and heterogeneous biomedical data, like patient records, into a centralized data structure. In contrast to existing work, such as that of Lesniak et al. 2007, the ontology component enables the storage of constantly evolving object-attribute-data. In addition, the peak component ensures the fast storage and retrieval of metabolic data. As opposed to the open source database TrialDB [LINK], a database model was designed, not only utilizing the EAV principal but also including simple classes and relations. The developed IMS database application offers a graphical user interface (GUI) which includes several windows, tabs, buttons and dialogues to provide an intuitive interaction between end-user and application.

resource.name: BiCluE

resource.name: GEDEVO-M
resource.description: GEDEVO-M is an extension of the idea implemented in GEDEVO to multiple input networks. GEDEVO-M aims to minimize the sum of GEDs between every pair of input networks.

resource.name: GEDEVO
resource.description: GEDEVO, is a software tool for solving the network alignment problem. GEDEVO stands for Graph Edit Distance + EVOlution and it utilizes the evolutionary computing strategies for solving the so-called Graph Edit Distance problem.
